document.docAuthor: Cobo, M. Carmen & Kocot, Kevin M.
document.masterDocTitle: On the diversity of abyssal Dondersiidae (Mollusca: Aplacophora) with the description of a new genus, six new species, and a review of the family

Type species.
Nematomenia flavens ( Pruvot, 1890 )
, Mediterranean and North Sea 45‾
167 m
.

bibRefCitation.author: Hubrecht, A. W.
bibRefCitation.refString: Hubrecht, A. W. (1888) Dondersia festiva gen. et spec. nov. In: Feestbundel aan Franciscus Cornelis Donders op den 27 sten. Mei 1888, aangeboden door het Nederlandsch Tijdschrift voor Geneeskunde. F. van Rossen, Amsterdam, pp. 324 - 339.

tr.td: Central denticles joined in the apex. Smaller lateral pair Radular plate serrated

bibRefCitation.author: Salvini-Plawen, L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Salvini-Plawen, L. (1978) Antarktische und Subantarktische Solenogastres - Eine monographie: 1898 - 1974. Zoologica, 128, 1 - 315.

tr.td: apex. Lateral pair that can be of the same longitude and that can also have joined apex Radular plate no serrated

bibRefCitation.author: Salvini-Plawen, L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Salvini-Plawen, L. (1978) Antarktische und Subantarktische Solenogastres - Eine monographie: 1898 - 1974. Zoologica, 128, 1 - 315.

bibRefCitation.author: Simroth, H.
bibRefCitation.refString: Simroth, H. (1893) Aplacophora. In: Bronn, H. G. (Ed.), Die Klassen und Ordnungen des Thier-Reichs, 3 (1), 128 - 233.

tr.td: Each pair of denticles joined in the apex. All denticles of the same longitude.

bibRefCitation.author: Pruvot, G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Pruvot, G. (1899) Sur deux Neomeniens nouveaux de la Mediterranee. Archives de Zoologie Experimentale et Generale, 3 (7), 461 - 509.

tr.td: Curved denticles almost joined in the apex

bibRefCitation.author: Leloup, E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Leloup, E. (1948) Un nouveau Solenogastre a peau nue de l'Ocean Glaciar Arctique, Micromenia simplex g. nov., sp. nov. Bulletin du Museum d'Histoire Naturelle de Belgique, 24 (19), 1 - 7.

tr.td: Curved denticles almost joined in the apex

bibRefCitation.author: Buchinger, T. & Handl, C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Buchinger, T. & Handl, C. (1996) Squamatoherpia tricuspidata gen. n. et sp. n. aus der Nordsee (Mollusca: Solenogastres: Dondersiidae). Annalen des Naturhistorischen Museums in Wien, 98 B, 57 - 63.

tr.td: Lateral denticles curved. Central denticle straight Narrow radular plate

bibRefCitation.author: Buchinger, T. & Handl, C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Buchinger, T. & Handl, C. (1996) Squamatoherpia tricuspidata gen. n. et sp. n. aus der Nordsee (Mollusca: Solenogastres: Dondersiidae). Annalen des Naturhistorischen Museums in Wien, 98 B, 57 - 63.

tr.td: bearing 3 denticles in each side. Narrow, straight and equidistant denticles. The inner-most denticles are the smallest

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Elongate body with or without keel. Leaf-shaped scales as major sclerites, and with oar-shaped, pallet-shaped, or laminar scales scattered between them. With common atrio-buccal cavity. Monoserial radula with four denticles that narrow distally, neighboring denticles usually joined at the apex, or radula lacking. With or without dorsoterminal sensory organ. With or without copulatory stylets. Without respiratory folds.
